name: Best Western Zion Park Inn

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. The scenery is beautiful - it almost feels like you're right inside Zion National Park. The pool was very nice, clean and a comfortable respite from the 115 degree heat. Rooms were a good size, very clean, and all the hotel employees were attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Fabulous scenery!
reviews.text: All in all, one of the nicest moderately-priced hotels we've stayed in. We'll go back to Zion again, and we'll definitely stay here.

The hotel is new, modern, with a large pool, kiddie pool and sauna. The free Springdale shuttle is super convenient, right at the edge of the hotel property, with a shelter and benches for the short wait. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel is near the outskirts of Springdale, but it's a short ride (or walk) to "downtown" or the park.
reviews.title: good choice for Zion

reviews.text: My family of 5 stayed here for a night while in Zion. It was a nice BW. The rooms were clean, the location was great, and it had a nice pool. The shuttle location was convenient for the park. The decor was lodge-type and attractive. Our room wasn't overly spacious but it worked. The beds were ok. We chose this BW for its location knowing it wouldn't be a 4* establishment. We were disappointed it didn't offer continental breakfast. We ordered dinner to go from the attached restaurant. It was tasty but pricey. We would probably choose to stay here again when in Zion.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Wow this Best Western is in a great location to Zion National park. My husband and I stayed here three nights and had a great time. The motel was very clean and the best part is the view from the back porch/patio area. Especially at night there is a great view of the sky with the moon and stars. Springdale is a cute little town. There is a free shuttle stop right outside the Best Western it makes stops in Springdale so if you get tired of walking you can take it to several restaurants. This shuttle also takes you to the Park. It is an easy walk to several restaurants and shops. We did not eat at the Restaurant at the Best Western we did enjoy anice dinner across the street at the Bit and Spur. They have some really good mexican food. We also recommend Pizza and Noodle company which is a little farther down the street they have great pizza. We also ate at Oscars which was good.
reviews.title: Spectacular & Relaxing
Wow Great Place
reviews.text: This is what vacation is all about. We were on our way home from a go, go, go vacation and wanted to drive through Zion and see Bryce Canyon. It was starting to get late and we wanted to see the sites in the day time. My wife said "Let's stop" and this is the first place we saw. From the outside I was assuming that after Disneyland we would not have the budget for a place like this. We walked in and were given a VERY reasonable rate. We took the kids swimming and watched the moon crest over the mountains from the pool. This place gave us the perfect end to a great vacation. The staff was friendly and the room was beautiful. The deck out the back of the lobby is so nice, you can just sit and relax with an amazing view. The only problem we had was time! We wish we could have stayed longer than just one night. We are already planing to return for a stay without the kids. It is a very romantic place.

reviews.title: Great food and views
reviews.text: Great views and food at the hotel in Zion which is a lovely little town. Room 260 provides great views. 11/2 to 2 days will enable you to see the best of Zion including some of the best walks. Park just inside the park and use the shuttle; it's excellent.

We stayed two nights here as part of our honeymoon adventure around southern Utah. It was absolutely wonderfull. The setting is very picturesque being situated by the Virgin river just a short distance from the Zion Canyon park entrance. It is a very modern hotel but not at the expense of its look and feel in its surroundings; at first glance, you think you are staying in a log cabin. The Switchback grill across the car lot is where you eat and it was very pleasant. It also benefitted us by being the local liquor store as well so no problem if you want a bottle of wine in the evening. Springdale operates a free bus service up to the park entrance and one of the stops is on the road opposite the hotel so getting to the park is very easy. There is plenty of parking space and being able park within 10 yards of our hotel door made getting the luggage in and out very easy.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: We tried to book at the Desert Pearl on very short notice over Labour Weekend. This is the only place Springdale seemed to have!
reviews.title: A very good value good hotel

reviews.text: Not disappointed at all. We took a family room (Rm 169) $123 with AAA discount. (This is basically two rooms with the interlinking doors open and one half's bathroom converted into a kitchette. Would have liked them to have gotten rid of both these doors and replaced with a regular one - but no big deal).
reviews.title: Loved it! Favorite hotel of the entire trip
Magic spot
reviews.text: Room was clean, well furnished and pretty comfortable. TV in bedroom and one in living room. Very nice fully fitted and equipped kitchenette with clean microwave and large fridgefreezer. Bowls, dishes, bottleopener etc all included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV only offered small selection of usual channels (HBO included) and pretty good reception - for a hotel!
reviews.title: Great location, lovely town
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: Bathroom, fine. Beds were good, not sagging at all. Pillows bad, but ordered more from reception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Room #232 on the corner. Corner rooms have an extra ceiling window and cathedral ceilings.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel
Worst Hotel Ever
reviews.text: -Great cabinlike hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Great patios off each hallway.
reviews.title: Rather Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Clean.
reviews.title: What a view, from our room and the hot tub!!!

likes.liked: — the hot tub and view from our room
likes.disliked: — the smallish size of the room

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: -Great parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 2 nights around Christmas. Everything in the town of Springdale is closed or open only for a short period at night during the off-season. The Bestwestern website boasts of a restaurant attached to it. DO NOT BELIEVE THAT. It is closed in the off-season. There was no food available anywhere in the town the night we arrived (around 7pm) and the person at the reception did not seem to care one bit or offer any suggestions.The hotel room was also very average. The view from the hotel was not that great either.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw a lot of other hotels / inns that looked better, seemed to have a better view around them and had atleast a coffee shop so you can get breakfast. We were so fed up of this place we left after staying there one night. The zion national park itself was wonderful, but we would recommend it as a day trip.
reviews.title: Loved our Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS, ESPECIALLY IN THE OFF SEASON.
reviews.title: Great Best Western property!

reviews.text: My husband and I did a national park touring for our honeymoon and Zion was one of our legs. I had stayed at the Best Western in Zion before and had pleasant memories so we decided to stay there again during our three night leg in Zion. Although we had reservations about staying at a Best Western on our honeymoon, the hotel did not disappoint!
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We were given a lovely and completely clean room overlooking the beautiful mountains and pool area. The next morning we woke up and the entire room was red! The sunlight coming off of the mountains had illuminated the room. It was a magical way to start our trip.
reviews.title: Loved Everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very good. It appears new and was very clean. We paid about $100 and I think it was worth it. I was concerned about staying out of the park, but the free shuttle bus service is excellent. It is quick and convienent and free. Note of caution: the hotel does not provide any breakfast and the restuant attached to the hotel is expensive for breakfast. We got in the car and drive up into town for a much more reasonable breakfast.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveling with a dog is always an adventure, but hotels like this make it more difficult. The room was nice and clean, but at checkin, I was informed that pets were absolutely not allowed to be left unattended in the room. This was an issue since pets are only allowed on one trail in Zion National Park. The man at the desk did give me the name of of a kennel, but that isn't an option for our dog. We always travel with his crate, which he feels safe in, so he just crawls in and sleeps the entire time (no barking, no room destruction). So we were able to get away with leaving him in the room and no one was the wiser.
reviews.title: Nice room, lame pet policy

reviews.text: I just have a problem with a hotel that claims to be dog friendly and proceeds to charge a fee to have the pet in the room, but then insists you can't leave them in the room. Then what is the fee for? If they are worried about room destruction, they can require dogs be crated if left in the room or charge a refundable deposit. If they are worried about noise bothering other guests, they can easily take your phone number and inform you if your pet is a problem and then take steps to correct the problem.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - But Compare Prices

likes.disliked: — Price relative to comparable hotels in the area

reviews.title: A Good Choice With No Breakfast
reviews.text: You can't beat Zion Nat'l Park for location - but location and scenery aside, lets discuss the hotel.

The room was clean and what one can expect at most Best Western motels. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and though the room wasn't overly spacious, it wasn't cramped either. The room had a good sized fridge in it, which was nice for storing groceries.
reviews.title: Very nice choice, imho better than Zion Lodge (inside the park)

likes.liked: — location, price, heated pool and hot tub

reviews.text: Our room was clean, comfortable and nicely located (exactly what we requested) with an amazing view of red-rock cliffs above. The hotel staff offered us free bag breakfast on the first day because their restaurant was closed. Our room had a fridge in it and a microwave down the hall which was helpful for tired kids after a day of hiking Zion. Nice hot tub! This is my second time at this hotel and I would come stay again.
reviews.title: Nice place, nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous views; room quite comfortable and clean; location convenient to Zion Park; good restaurants nearby; great area to walk nearby; quiet room, but stayed upstairs - in off season; night desk clerks could be friendlier - maybe they are tired.
reviews.title: Defintely worth a return visit!

reviews.text: Our stay in September was a return visit to this Best Western which is quite close to the entrance of Zion National Park. We first stayed here in 2004 and the three years showed in that things were looking a little more worn than we were first here. However, our room was clean and a reasonable size with 2 queen beds, fridge, TV and coffee maker. It was very quiet with the exception of the noise generated by the fridge was did at times become irritating. There was free wireless internet access in the room but only one spare socket in which to plug anything in. This hotel would benefit from the addition of a complimentary breakfast but other than that it was a good option for a visit to Zion.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel close to the park

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid December 07 and hotel is a couple of minutes from the entrance to the park. Room was plenty big enough and the hotel had some nice, clean public areas. This place had everything we needed including a good laundry room. Springdale extremely quiet at this time of year but hotel desk very helpful and gave a list of restaurants and opening times. Most of the galleries also shut at this time of year but don't be put off going to Zion in the winter - no crowds on the trails and next door to the hotel was a bar/restaurant to wind down in after a day out in the park. I can't vouch for any time other than winter but wouldn't hesitate to use BW Zion again.
reviews.title: Had everything we needed

likes.liked: — plenty of space and great view
likes.disliked: — no individuality to room due to it being a chain

reviews.text: Wow. Beautiful hotel - much more than you'd ever expect from a Best Western. Very nice, modern accommodations, comfortable, clean room, great beds. Very nice pool area with a small putting green and other nice landscaping features.
reviews.title: Very nice

aka: Best Western Zion Park Hotel Springdale
description: Recently renovated, all new Guest rooms! Deluxe Breakfast Buffet at the Switchback Grille included in room rate. Located just a mile and a half from the south entrance of Zion National Park. Free seasonal shuttle. 2 restaurants, includes fine dining and sports grill. Exceptional customer service is a heartfelt tradition.
